articles.description: An activist short-seller, a New York hedge fund, a Mauritius-based investment vehicle and a broker tied to a big Indian bank: All played a role in one of the world’s most damaging short-seller attacks.

articles.author: Sunil Shankar Matkar
articles.title: Trading Plan: Will Bank Nifty continue to underperform Nifty 50? - Moneycontrol
articles.description: The Nifty 50 needs to give a decisive close above 24,200, the key hurdle, for further sharp upmove towards 24,500 levels. Until then, consolidation may continue with support at 24,000, experts said.
articles.content: The market recorded a new high but failed to hold on to those gains due to profit booking pressure at higher levels, indicating some tiredness among bulls with Bank Nifty signaling caution, on July 2… [+4822 chars]
